video.name: VEGAN TIRAMISU CHIA PUDDING | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Tiramisu Chia Seed Pudding! Coffee Chocolate Chia pudding layered with creamy vanilla layer topped with whipped coconut cream and cocoa powder. Glutenfree Soyfree Nutfree 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/10/tiramisu-chia-seed-pudding.html

When you can have Tiramisu Chia seed pudding for breakfast, then why wouldnâ€™t you!

This easy chia pudding has 3 layers. The Chocolate Coffee layer has warmed non dairy milk, vanilla, cocoa powder, some coffee, maple syrup or other sweetener, and chia seeds. The warmed milk helps the chia seed absorb the liquid evenly and quickly and the pudding thickens within 15 mins!

For the cream layer I use warmed non dairy milk, almond extract, a pinch of salt and lemon juice for the cheese flavor, maple syrup or other sweetener, and chia seeds. The almond extract adds a bit of amaretto flavor without the liquor. You can add the extract to either the chocolate layer or the cream layer. The lemon and salt add a slight cream cheese like flavor which works amazingly. You can omit them for a plain vanilla pudding layer. The third layer is some fluffy whipped coconut cream and a dusting of good cocoa! and done.

You can make this without coffee and chocolate and vanilla layer pudding. Make it into Overnight oats for less chia seed texture. Loads of options on the post!

#veganricha #chiapudding #easyveganrecipes #tiramisuchiapudding #veganbreakfast

INDIAN KITCHEN:  https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-indian-kitchen-cookbook
EVERYDAY KITCHEN: https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen

recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup warm non milk (such as almond, soy, oat milk or light coconut milk)
1 tbsp brewed coffee (or 1/4 tsp instant coffee)
1/2 cup warm non dairy milk (, such as almond, soy, oat or light coconut milk)
a few drops almond extract (, or vanilla extract, or both)

recipeInstructions.text: Chocolate Chia Pudding: Mix the warmed non dairy milk, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, maple syrup with a whisk. Then add the chia seeds and let sit for 15 mins to thicken. (see notes for overnight oats variation)
recipeInstructions.name: Chocolate Chia Pudding: Mix the warmed non dairy milk, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, maple syrup with a whisk. Then add the chia seeds and let sit for 15 mins to thicken. (see notes for overnight oats variation)

recipeInstructions.text: Mascarpone Cream Chia Pudding: Mix the warmed non dairy milk, almond extract and salt. Add chia seeds and let sit for 15 minutes to thicken. then fold in lemon juice. (Fold in 2-3 tbsp whipped coconut cream for creamier layer).
recipeInstructions.name: Mascarpone Cream Chia Pudding: Mix the warmed non dairy milk, almond extract and salt. Add chia seeds and let sit for 15 minutes to thicken. then fold in lemon juice. (Fold in 2-3 tbsp whipped coconut cream for creamier layer).

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust sweet. Add a tsp or so more chia seeds to either pudding layer if not thickened to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and adjust sweet. Add a tsp or so more chia seeds to either pudding layer if not thickened to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spoonfuls into serving containers (I use weck jars and layer chocolate then cream layer). Top with 1-2 tbsp whipped coconut cream or just coconut cream. Dust with cocoa powder. Chill for a few hours and serve. You can also add granola or fresh fruits on top to serve.Store: Refrigerate for upto 3 days.
recipeInstructions.name: Add spoonfuls into serving containers (I use weck jars and layer chocolate then cream layer). Top with 1-2 tbsp whipped coconut cream or just coconut cream. Dust with cocoa powder. Chill for a few hours and serve. You can also add granola or fresh fruits on top to serve.Store: Refrigerate for upto 3 days.
